title: Importance in decision-making process when purchasing CE in the U.S. 2013
summary: This grouped bar chart represents 14 different Responses on X-axis for 2 groups 18-49, and 50+. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
Out of all 2 groups, 50+ had the highest Share of respondents in Response Price and 50+ had the lowest Share of respondents in Response Friends have it.
In Response Price, 18-49 had the highest Share of respondents among all 14 Responses and it has the lowest Share of respondents in Response Family members have it.
There is a gap of 51.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for 18-49 in Response Price and Family members have it.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 14 different Responses for 2 groups 18-49, and 50+ that are presented on the X-axis.
Out of all 2 groups, 50+ had the highest Share of respondents in Response Price and 50+ had the lowest Share of respondents in Response Friends have it.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 14 different Responses on X-axis for 2 groups 18-49, and 50+. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
Out of all 2 groups, 50+ had the highest Share of respondents in Response Price and 50+ had the lowest Share of respondents in Response Friends have it.
In Response Price, 18-49 had the highest Share of respondents among all 14 Responses and it has the lowest Share of respondents in Response Family members have it.
There is a gap of 51.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for 18-49 in Response Price and Family members have it.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 14 different Responses for 2 groups 18-49, and 50+ that are presented on the X-axis.
Response Price had the maximum Share of respondents among all 2 groups, and it was for 50+. The minimum Share of respondents was observed in Response Friends have it for 50+.
Among all the Responses, 18-49 had the highest Share of respondents 83.0 in Response Price and lowest value 32.0 in Response Family members have it.
There is a gap of 51.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for 18-49 in Response Price and Family members have it.
Out of all 2 groups, the highest gap between the maximum and minimum Share of respondents was found in case of 18-49.
On average, the Response Price had the highest Share of respondents for all 2 groups 18-49, and 50+. Whereas Friends have it had the lowest average Share of respondents.
